Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWStarterMeans of RecreationUnit–III : Our Needs
8
People work the whole day and get tired. They want to relax and have fun in 
different ways. Doing some thing to relax is called recreation. Ther e are 
different types of recreational activities such as playing games, watching T.V., 
listening to music, going on a picnic, pain ting etc.
Such recreational activities relax and refresh us and mak e us happ y and 
cheerful. They fill us with ener gy to go back to work again.! Can you name the activities shown in the given pictur es?
! Why do we do such activities?
We all love to play different kinds of games. Games provide us enjo ymen t on one 
hand and good health on the other . Sports and games play a major role in keeping a 
person fit and fine. They also help in boos ting the immunity and increasing the 
intellectual and social skills of a person.Games and Sports1. 2. 3. 4.
Environmental Studies-461

Schools too have understood the 
import ance of games and sports and so, 
adop ted sports as an in tegral part of the 
curriculum. Students get training of 
various sports in school with the facilities 
which are unavailable at homes like a 
large field, coaches, equipmen t etc.
In schools, games are more technic al and Indoor games–  Games such as ludo , cards, chess, carrom, snak es and ladder s, 
Chinese check ers etc. are usually played inside the home. So they are called indoor 
games.
Outdoor games– Games such as cricket, football, basket ball, volley ball, 
badmin ton, etc. are played in the field or play ground. So, they are called outdoor 
games.
Outdoor Games: 
An Integral P art of School Curriculum
Traditional games–  Some games are popular in villag es and small towns rather 
than cities. Marbles, Kho-kho , hopscotch, spinning the top, gilli danda, flying kites 
etc. are some traditional games.
Environmental Studies-4 62

comple x as they are played by following the rules and guidelines.
Rules in games–  Every game has its own rules. It is very import ant that every sports 
person mus t play a fair game and obey all the rules of the game. Some times, to win, 
players out for unfair means which is an injus tice to a game. To avoid fights and to 
play in a fair manner , a game can have a referee. However, the referee should be 
impartial and should be aware of the rules of the game.
Fair play– Games should be played fairly. We can ensur e fair play by following 
certain poin ts–
! We should have respect for the rules of the game and for the opponen ts.
! We should not intentionally hurt anyone or use bad words while playing.
! We should play the game with integrity .
! We mus t realiz e that it is not import ant to always win a game. We mus t play 
with the spirit of the game.
It was belie ved that girls cannot play as well as boys and there are some games 
which can only be played by boys. But this belie f is comple tely vanished and we 
have man y females like Sania Mirz a, Saina Nehwal, P.T. Usha, Anjali Bhagw at, 
Apur vi Chandela, Anjum Chopr a, Mithali Raj etc. who have established their names 
in the history of sports. Thus, they have broken the gender stereo type in games.Breaking Gender Stereotype
Like all childr en Raman loves to play. His parents encourage him to play different 
games. But he pla ys only during pla y time. He t ells his friends, "W e should divide Case Study
Environmental Studies-463

You  Know Must 
Sports bring out the best in the individu al. They develop the spirit of 
competition and true sportsmanship irrespective of caste, gend er or 
religion.out time in such a way that we get enough time for studying , playing and other 
activities."
Raman plays with all the childr en of his colon y. His friends are from all types of 
families in the neighbourhood. Some are poor , some are rich. His friends belong to 
different religions and casts. In the beginning , his friends didn't like to play with 
girls. But now, his friends have also realised that all games requir e skills and girls 
and boys can play together as equals.
On holida ys, Raman goes out for a picnic with his family . He goes to fly kites with his 
father on some special days like Basan t Panchami, Mak ar Sankr anti, Independence 
Day etc. Some times, on festivals like Dussehr a, Diwali, Teej etc he goes to a fair with 
his family to have fun but he never eats uncovered food from the vendor s.
Raman also loves family functions like marriag es and birthda ys. He and his family 
enjo ys man y festivals like Diwali, Eid, Chris tmas and Gurupur ab with all other 
people in the neighbourhood. Raman's family knows that we need recreational 
activities to keep ourselves fresh and fit.
! Recreation – An activity that people do to get relaxed or 
have fun
! Immunity – Resistance or protection against diseases
! Intellectual – Ability to think
! Curriculum – Syllabus
! Integral part – Essential component
! Referee – The official who controls the game in some 
sports(Knowledge )
Key termsKey termsKey terms

Ÿ Playing together help s to build confidence, under standing and respect for 
one another .
Ÿ Kite flying , outings, family gatherings and celebr ations etc. are other means 
of recreation.

Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWStarterTravel and MoneyUnit–III : Our Needs
9
! In the pictur es given above, write L for land transport, W for water transport 
and A for air transport.
! Which is the fastest means of transport?
People may have to travel from place to place for various reasons.
Ÿ They may buy goods from one place and sell them in another place.
Ÿ They may go in sear ch of work.
Ÿ They may travel to enjo y their vacation.
Ÿ They may travel to attend some family functions etc. 
Travelling gives us the chance to engage in an activity to develop new skills and 
discover new cultur e of various places. Today, people use different means of  
Environmental Studies-4 68

transport to go from one place to another . Some of them are cars, buses, scooters, 
trains, aeroplanes etc.
Private and Public V ehicles
Vehicles like scooters, motorcycles and cars are used for our personal use. These 
are called private vehicles. We do not need to buy tickets for travelling in our 
private vehicles. We just need to get them filled with fuel.
But, when we travel by vehicles like buses, trains, ships and aeroplanes, we have to 
pay for travel. These are called public vehicles. When we use public transport, we 
need to buy tickets. We pay mone y to buy tickets. Now a days, we can book our 
tickets even through our mobile phones.
Currency
Every country has a particular type of mone y that is used for buying things in that 
country. It is called the currency of that country. Indian currency is called the rupee 
(!). It consis ts of coins and bank notes. 
Coins– Mone y made of metal is called a coin. Coins are round and flat and have two 
sides. On one side, its value and the year of minting is mark ed. This side is called 
head. On the other side is the National Emblem. This side is called tail.
Coins have a great historical import ance. In ancien t times, kings used coins made 
up of gold, silver or bronze known as mohar s. Some coins of different values are 
shown belo w.
The smalles t unit of Indian mone y is paise. One hundr ed paise mak e a rupee.
Bank notes ( Curr ency notes)– A currency note has two faces. On one face, each 
Indian note has its value written in the centre. All the notes are signed by the 
governor of the Reser ve Bank of India (RBI) both in Hindi and English. Every note 
has a particular code number which is written at the top left hand corner and 
bottom right hand corner . A pictur e of our National Emblem is printed at the 
Environmental Studies-469

bottom right hand side and a pictur e of Maha tma Gandhi is sligh tly to the left of the 
centre. 
On the other face, each note has a pictur e of our National Monumen t. For 
example, 50 rupee note has a pictur e of Hampi, 10 rupee note has a pictur e of Sun 
temple and 500 rupee note has pictur e of Red fort. On the sligh t left hand side, you 
can see the value of the note written in words in different languag es. 
Watermark– Watermark is an imag e or a pattern on a currency note. It can be seen 
only when light passes through it. Water mark is added to prevent circulation of 
fake currency .
Security thread–  It is a thin ribbon woven into a note. This also prevents copying of 
currency notes. 
Red FortNumber c ode

languag esNumber c ode

Wrap-  U p Wrap-  U pKey Poin ts of the Chap terKnow Y our National Emblem
Our National Emblem has been taken from the Ashok a pillar of 
Sarna th. This emblem was adop ted on 26 Januar y, 1950, when 
India became a republic. It has a pictur e of four lions standing 
back to back. But we can see only three lions from one side. 
These four lions are moun ted a ground abacus. The abacus 
shows an elephant, a galloping horse, a bull and a lion 
separ ated by a chakr a over the bell shaped lotus. The words 
'Satyameva Jayate' meaning 'Truth Alone Triumphs' are 
inscribed belo w the abacus in Devnag ari scrip t.
Some mos t traded interna tional currencies are–
 US Dollar
 Euro
 Japanese Yen
 Pound sterling
 Australian dollar
 Swiss franc
 Canadian dollarInternational Currencies
National Emblem

only when light passes through it.

Let’sKNOW Let’sKNOWStarterTransport
and CommunicationUnit–III : Our Needs
10
! Can you guess, wha t is the pigeon doing in this 
pictur e?
! How do you send messag es to your relatives?
! How do you go to see them?
We all travel from one place to another for different reasons e.g. going to 
school, going to the work place, to see or visit another place. We can use a car, 
bus, train, ship or an aeroplane for this purpose. All these vehicles are called 
means of transport.
The different means of transport are–
1. Land Transport – e.g. cars, buses, scooters, trains etc.
2. Water Transport – ships, boats, steamer s etc.
3. Air Transport – aeroplanes, helic opters, rockets etc.Means of T ransport
We choose a means of transport depending on different factors such as:
! distance to be tavelled.
! time and mone y we have.
! availability of the means of transport.  
Environmental Studies-475

Communication
The process of speaking , writing or using signs and sounds to shar e ideas and 
informa tion is called communic ation. Ther e are man y ways of communic ating with 
other s. Mos t of the people communic ate by speaking , listening and writing.
People who cannot speak and hear communic ate through sign languag e i.e. 
through the movemen ts of their hands and fingers.
Long ago, people used to send messag es by pigeons and horse rider s. Now-a-da ys 
we have various fast and easy means of communic ation.The world's fastest train is the Shanghai Maglev.You  Know Must (Knowledge )
Travel and communic ation are related to each other . Whe ther learning a new 
language, sharing cultural ideas or swapping stories, travel sharpens our 
communic ation skills.
Types of Communication
2. Electronic Communication– Telephones, mobile phones, computers, 
interne t and fax machines are some means of electr onic communic ation. 
! Telephone– A telephone is the fastest means of 
communic ation. Mobile phones have made communic ation 
very easy. Using mobile phones, we can communic ate even 
when we are travelling.
1. Postal Communic ation– Letters, are the 
most common means of 
communication. We use post cards, 
inland letters, envelopes, postage 
stamps etc. for writing and sending 
letters. Speed post and courier services 
can also be used to send urgent 
!  A fax machine is used to instantly send Fax Machine–
written messages, documents and photographs to 
someone . It is connect ed to a telephone line. Instant 
messaging and e-mail have largely replaced faxing for 
Environmental Studies-4 76

! Interne t is a very useful means of communic ation. It has made the Interne t– 
whole world a small workplace. We can surf for any informa tion on the 
interne t with the help of sear ch engines within no time. The mos t commonly 
used sear ch engine is Google. We can send pictur es and written messag es 
from one comput er to another through interne t. This is called an e-mail 
(electr onic mail) .
3. Mass Communic ation– Mass communic ation is a way of communic ating  
with a large number of people at the same time. Newspaper s, mag azine, 
radio and televison are different means of mass communic ation. Digit al 
media is the latest means of mass communic ation. It includes social media 
sites, web sites and interne t based radio and television.
Artificial satellites are launched into the space. They 
enable us to see sports and other events 'live' from any 
part of the world. They also help in receiving telephone 
and interne t signals.Artificial Satellites
Charles Babba ge is known as the 'Father of Comput er'.You  Know Must (Knowledge ) gener al communic ation. However, it still exists in the work place particularly   
for medic al and legal professionals, bank s, insur ance companies etc.
Environmental Studies-477

and tell interesting stories and facts about the

enjo y later.
! Postman delivers letters and Postman– 
parcels to people's house.
!  They tell us about import ant News Report ers–
events happening around the world through the 
newspaper or television etc.
